alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 10:00AM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...York County, South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 AM EST, Minor flooding was occurring in low-lying and poor drainage areas near Wildcat Creek following heavy rain Saturday and early this morning. McConnells Highway, Saluda Rd, and Highway 324 may be flooded. - Flooding impacts will continue through midday today, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe when heavy runoff and drainage are occurring.
